JRASERVER-12124:
The CSV Import Wizard does not work anymore with configuration files containing custome fields.
Every existing custom field is mapped to "None".

In the list of unmapped custom fields the name of the unmapped column appears wrong:

Unmapped CSV header
ActionexistingCustomField

(see also attachment).
There should be a blank or another Separator between "Action" (the column name)
and "existingCustomField" (the type of field).
Probably due to this missing separator the wizard cannot match the column name!

Using the same import configuration file just for doing an import shows no problem.
The data is imported correctly. Only the wizard does not work anymore, so if you have
to modify the import configuration you have to do this by editing the cfg file manually.

CONFSERVER-37969:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37969].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The IM Presence Macro does not work with Skype contacts as they are served of off HTTP and not HTTPS.
The Icon will also not load.

h3. Environment
* Cloud with HTTPS
* Server with or without HTTPS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Insert the IM presence macro
# Select Skype and enter a username

h3. Expected Results
A Skype button is shown

h3. Actual Results
A broken image is shown in Confluence Cloud and Confluence Server with HTTPS.
A Text only link is shown in Confluence Server over HTTP.
 
h3. Notes

BAM-18848:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a Windows Active Directory with *MaxPageSize* set to 1000
# Make sure the AD has MORE than 1000 users
# Run an LDAP search with filter settings from *atlassian-users.xml* and save the results
# Enable the following debug in Bamboo - this will show up the filter used to get the results from AD
||Classpath|com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap|
||Type|DEBUG|
# Try to give permission to a user not returned in step 3

h3. Expected Results
Bamboo is able to find the user and the permission can be assigned

h3. Actual Results
Bamboo only returns the user if he is inside the first 1000 results returned by the default LDAP search. Bamboo runs every time a the same default search, not a restricted search depending on what the user is typing.

h3.Workaround
Reduce the number of users and groups returned using a more restricted LDAP configuration on *atlassian-users.xml*

h3. Notes
If the number of results is big (not restricted to 1000 - like the scenario, we have when using OpenLDAP, ApacheDS etc) the instance might end up with performance problems: [\[BAM\-18755\] Bamboo retrieves all users from LDAP when adding global permissions|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-18755]

If the search is restricted we will lose results as we have in the past:[\[BAM\-18051\] Bamboo does not paginate records over MaxPageSize|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-18051]
SERVER-39092:
In ReplicationStateTransitionLockGuard destructor, we have an invariant which checks for  [lock result not equal to LOCK_WAITING|https://github.com/mongodb/mongo/blob/fe187bdf22a6c67d5ff6f035d51a308870255e10/src/mongo/db/concurrency/replication_state_transition_lock_guard.cpp#L95] before unlocking the rstl lock. But, for the below valid event sequence,  we would be calling the ReplicationStateTransitionLockGuard destructor with _result set as "LOCK_WAITING" to unlock the rstl lock.

1) Thread A  issues stepdown cmd ( can be triggered either by heartbeat or user) .

2) Thread B issues conditional stepdown triggered by the user.

3) -Thread A marks thread B as killed.-  (*EDIT* : One step down thread cannot mark another step down thread as killed, because during step down we currently kill only user operations that have taken global lock in X, IX and IS mode. Step down thread only try to take RSTL lock in X mode and not global lock.)

3) Thread A acquires the rstl lock in X mode.

4) Thread B enqueues the rstl lock and set the __result as LOCK__WAITING.

5) Thread B calls ReplicationStateTransitionLockGuard::waitForLockUntil with non-zero timeout.

6) Thread B wait for rstl lock -is interrupted- (or even for time out case) and lead to calling ReplicationStateTransitionLockGuard destructor with __result as "LOCK__WAITING" leading to invariant failure. (*EDIT:* Thread B can time out waiting for the lock).

*Note:* There is no need to worry that the rstl lock state won't be cleaned up, because [unlockOnErrorGuard|https://github.com/mongodb/mongo/blob/fe187bdf22a6c67d5ff6f035d51a308870255e10/src/mongo/db/concurrency/lock_state.cpp#L837-L853] in LockerImpl::lockComplete will clean up the state in the lock manger and in the locker on any failed lock attempts. Effectively when we hit the ReplicationStateTransitionLockGuard destructor, there is nothing to clean up for the above scenario.
CONFCLOUD-33292:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33292].
  {panel}

if you are trying to write a template for use with the AutoExport plugin, and you need access to the exported URL of an arbitrary AbstractPage (ie: the current page, or any of it's children) for any reason (in my current situation: to pass as a query param in an ifram for an external service) there is no way to do this (from the template):

* $page.urlPath (java: AbstractPage.getUrlPath()) is the pre-exported path in confluence
* $autoexport.link($page) (java: ExportUtils.link(AbstractPage)) generates an <a href=""/> for the page, still using the pre-exported path
* ExportBeautifier will look for html nodes with "href" and "src" attributes and convert the paths, but it won't look for paths in arbitrary text (ie: script bodies, escaped in iframe params, etc...)

It would be helpful if some object was made available in the VelocityContext that had a simple method for retrieving the final exported (relative) url of an arbitrary AbstractPage as a String, which could then be included in the response as is (or if necessary for passing as an argument in some other url, escaped using $generalUtil.urlEncode())

JSWCLOUD-12619:
Steps to reproduce

1. Create a sprint with 2 stories with a few subtasks in each story. Set estimates on all subtasks. Start the sprint.
2. Check the burndown chart to verify that the number of hours remaining is correct.
3. Create a story in the backlog or a sprint that has not been started yet.
4. Move one of the subtasks from the current sprint from one of the stories. Choose change parent and select the story you created in the not started sprint / backlog.
5. The subtask is moved out of the current sprint / story, but the remaining hours in the burndown report is not updated with the hours moved out.

As a workaround I must always set remaining time for the subtask to 0 before moving, and then increase it again after it has been moved. If I forget this I am always confused and have to use more time than necessary on my reporting.
CONFSERVER-17402:
The mechanism in Confluence for creating custom decorators makes for a very brittle upgrade process. To take the example of a custom page decorator. You take a copy of the current page.vmd and paste it in to the Custom layout screen where you can then customize it.

After a Confluence upgrade, if the page.vmd has changed in the new version, there's a good chance that some page related operations will now be broken as the customised page.vmd stays in the Db.

At the very least we could flag during the upgrade process that there are customisations that should be manually checked.

SERVER-29097:
When a node receives a response to a heartbeat, it marks the node as alive at the same time as it updates its view of that node's optimes. This occurs [here|https://github.com/mongodb/mongo/blob/74ad35c14395a56fa77e7ec559a3150870a64699/src/mongo/db/repl/replication_coordinator_impl_heartbeat.cpp#L247-L260]. We only update the node's optimes though if the optimes have moved forward. If the node hasn't moved forward, that's no reason to not consider it alive. This can lead to spurious elections by unnecessarily throwing away liveness information.

There is a mismatch here between heartbeat request and response processing. In heartbeat requests, we do always [update liveness information|https://github.com/mongodb/mongo/blob/74ad35c14395a56fa77e7ec559a3150870a64699/src/mongo/db/repl/replication_coordinator_impl.cpp#L3446-L3447].

{panel}
{panel:title=Product update 5 March 2021}
Hello all, 

Thanks for your votes and feedback on this issue. We see this has an important feature, and is something we hope to implement in the future. It is a complex feature that crosses over a lot of team on our end. As such, we will not be positioned to prioritise this feature until at soonest the beginning of next financial year (July 2021). 

I will update this issue again at that time. 

Cheers, 

Ben.
{panel}
As a Project Administrator, I would like to have the ability to display a different URL for JIRA Service Desk (e.g. support.company.com) instead of jira.xxx.com
h3. Problem Definition

In JIRA Service Desk, customers must access JIRA by using a Service Desk URL, which can sometimes be quite a long path, depending on the portal.
h3. Suggested Solution
 - Create the ability to have a Short URL option on the portal, (like short url's in Confluence pages)
 - Create the ability to have customisable short URL's that could point to different portals in JIRA Service Desk.

h3. Workaround

None

Currently when a file with the same name is attached to a page multiple times, the attachment is versioned, but a user can only delete *all* of the versions.  In some situations, it would be useful to delete some of the versions.

JRASERVER-60906:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60906].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, only linked issues from the same JIRA instance will be able to export out into XML, Excel and etc.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be useful if users can export linked issues from different JIRA instance that they have connected to the JIRA instance via Application Link.

h3. Workaround
This can be done via REST API; please refer to [JIRA REST API for Remote Issue Links|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+REST+API+for+Remote+Issue+Links] for more information.

BAM-3705:
* It would be very useful if we could define priorities on our build plans.
 As an example, we have 2 types of build plans, one to compile and launch the tests and one to create a maven release.
 With a top priority field on our build plan of type release, a build newly launched would be placed directly on top of build plans already in the queue but with a minor priority.

 * -A manual reordering of the queue could be useful too-, implemented in Bamboo 2.3, see BAM-2503

CONFSERVER-35172:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-35172].
{panel}
When starting up Confluence, messaging like the following appear in the catalina logs:
{code:java}
29-Apr-2020 16:58:21.348 WARNING [main] org.apache.catalina.startup.SetAllPropertiesRule.begin [SetAllPropertiesRule]{Server/Service/Connector} Setting property 'debug' to '0' did not find a matching property.
...
29-Apr-2020 16:58:21.374 WARNING [main] org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.SetPropertiesRule.begin Match [Server/Service/Engine] failed to set property [debug] to [0]
29-Apr-2020 16:58:21.378 WARNING [main] org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.SetPropertiesRule.begin Match [Server/Service/Engine/Host] failed to set property [debug] to [0]
29-Apr-2020 16:58:21.423 WARNING [main] org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.SetPropertiesRule.begin Match [Server/Service/Engine/Host/Context] failed to set property [debug] to [0]
29-Apr-2020 16:58:21.437 WARNING [main] org.apache.tomcat.util.digester.SetPropertiesRule.begin Match [Server/Service/Engine/Host/Context] failed to set property [debug] to [0]
{code}
This is caused by the use of a property named *debug* in various sections of the server.xml file.  For example:
{code:java}
<Server port="8000" shutdown="SHUTDOWN" debug="0">
{code}
While this property may have been valid at some point in time, it is not currently valid according to [Apache Server documentation|https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-9.0-doc/config/context.html].

This suggestion is to remove all references to this property in the following files:
 * server.xml
 * synchrony-proxy.xml
 * conf#synchrony-proxy.xml

Additionally, all related online Atlassian documentation that includes examples of these xml files and reference this invalid property should be updated as well.
JRACLOUD-43767:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43767].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Take the latest JIRA Cloud backup.
# Install JIRA 6.4.6.
# Put the Cloud backup on the _JIRA Home > import_
# Run the Setup Wizard.
# Choose Import Data
# Put the Backup name on the File Name

*Expected Result*:
* There will be a warning, but there is an option that able to be clicked to proceed the restore.

*Actual Result:*
* The warning below appears:
!646cloudrestore.PNG|thumbnail!

*Workaround* 
Try restoring to a slightly older JIRA server version e.g. 6.4.5 if possible.

*NOTES:*
- JIRA 6.4 also have the same problem.

JSWSERVER-7707: Currently when you clone a ticket that is already assigned to an active sprint, the ticket is being assigned to that sprint as well forcing you to remove it from that sprint to put in the backlog. It makes no sense to always assign it to the sprint that the original ticket is assigned to.
JRACLOUD-7657:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-7657].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. However, there are a number of plugins that offer this post-function for JIRA Server on the [Atlassian Marketplace|http://marketplace.atlassian.com], and [JIRA Suite Utilities|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.googlecode.jira-suite-utilities], mentioned below, is free and pre-installed in JIRA Cloud.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

In version 3.2.2 it isn't possible to add through the web interface a post-function that updates the value of a custom field :-(

h3. Workaround

The [JIRA Suite Utilities|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.googlecode.jira-suite-utilities] third-party plugin offers a *Update custom field* post-function.

JRACLOUD-47728:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-47728].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , JIRA doesn't support viewing SVG image from JIRA . So , admin would like to raised a feature to render SVG image to PNG image from JIRA . Then send email notifications using PNG format.

h3. Suggested Solution
Auto render SVG image format to PNG when adding comment or attachment.

h3. Workaround 
Download the files from attachment then view it using SVG supported application or via online . For example http://www.rapidtables.com/web/tools/svg-viewer-editor.htm .

JRASERVER-14473:
Our #1 complaint here is that too many emails are received when a request is received and pushed through the workflow to closure quickly.  We however, do not want to give the developer the ability to go right from open to close, else they would rarely use the Start and Stop progress, along with a couple more custom steps we've added.  

Reporters, in many cases, receive 4 status updates within 1 minute, and Outlook doesn't order them chronologically, but by subject. 

A solution for this is that some logic could be added to the email engine to only send the last status update for each unique issue within 1 minute or some selectable #.

Check [this other bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-29357] with the same error.

(!) Please note that the service desk will be affected during the issue occurrence. 

*Workaround solution:*
Please use the "Manage Attachments" Menu to delete the attachment file and attach it again after compressed it. Or you can disable the thumbnail generation in the page "Administration >> System >> Attachments".
JSWSERVER-10393:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-10393].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# View an issue in JIRA that exists on an Agile Board.
# Choose More > Agile Board.

You'll get a spinning wheel for a while, then this partially-rendered dialog:

!agile.png!

I can reproduce easily under JIRA 6.2-OD-09-036 and JIRA Agile 6.3.7 (the current versions in OnDemand as of 17/2).

Only occurs when web resource batching is on (i.e. does not occur in Dev environments).

h3. Work-around

There is no work-around.

h3. Additional Info

It seems to work if the sprint is in more than one board. In that situation, upon clicking on the link, it would ask the user which board he/she would want to view it in. Clicking on these boards here would work
JSWCLOUD-11037:
h5.steps to reproduce 1
# associate the _Sprint_ field with a screen used for creating/editing subtasks;
# configure multiple tabs in the screen;
# position the _Sprint_ field at the bottom of a tab;
# attempt to create or edit a subtask.

*Result:* all fields are displayed in one tab, with an indent indicating different tabs; clicking tabs to switch doesn't have any effect - [^sprint1.png], [^sprint2.png].

h5.steps to reproduce 2
# associate the _Sprint_ field with a screen used for creating/editing subtasks;
# position the _Sprint_ field above a system field, e.g. _Component_, _Fix Version_, _Summary_;
# attempt to create or edit a subtask.

*Result:* _Sprint_ field will be displayed over the next field in order - [^sprint7.png].

h6.Special case
If another field with the name "Sprint" is configured in the same screen, and both fields are positioned next to each other, with the locked one on top, they're somewhat merged:  [^sprint5.png], [^sprint6.png].

Same screens for non subtasks are working correctly.

At an attempt to open the broken screen for a subtask, an error is thrown in the logs:

JRACLOUD-68370:
While creating custom field, it is not checked if field with same name already exist in default or custom field. This allow Admin to create duplicate field and causes confusion when that field is needed to be added in screen or reports, as which one to use.

Refer user feedback on this from community

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-discussions/JIRA-field-with-same-name-Duplicate-Field-names/td-p/693235]

 A feature is required that checks and stops Admin from creating such field.
SRCTREEWIN-4788: When committing changes, selecting a file in the list of modified files no longer displays the changes in the diff view.  The diff view always shows the changes in the first file in the list.
BAM-13763:
I would recommend that when a plan scheduled or in the process of being moved, that it be locked from:

1. activity - such as builds from running
2. changes (results, plans, jobs, branches) from being deleted or added
3. from the plan being moved again in a second process / window
JSWCLOUD-7351:
At the moment, you would need to click on the swimlane issuekey to open up the short summary screen on the right of Rapid board in Work Mode to see the Story points estimation. It would be great if we can show the Story Points estimation in the swimlane view as well. The small requirement such as this could means a lot in an Agile development.

!swimlane_storypoints.png|thumbnail!
JRACLOUD-72135:
{panel:title=Update 24 October 2019}
The "create sub-tasks" buttons are now available in the new issue view for Jira Service Desk projects.
{panel}

h2. Problem Definition
The new issue view in Jira Software includes the a button to create a sub-task and the old issue view for Jira Service Desk includes the Create sub-task option in the ellipses menu.

Neither of these are available in the new issue view in Jira Service Desk.

Current Jira Software (new issue view):
 !Screenshot 2019-05-24 at 09.30.04.png|thumbnail! 

Current Jira Service Desk (old issue view):
 !Screenshot 2019-05-24 at 09.30.27.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Suggested Solution
Include the create sub-task button in the Jira Service Desk new issue view.

h2. Workaround
Switch to the old issue view to access the Create sub-task option in the ellipses menu
FE-4136:
When I change the email address in JIRA/Crowd of a user, that user's email address isn't updated in FeCru.

1. Change email address in JIRA/Crowd.
2. Let the auto sync happen (I set mine to 5 minutes)
3. Email address change isn't reflected.
4. Add a user to JIRA/Crowd
5. Sync the user is added to FeCru
6. Manual sync users in FeCru
7. The user email address change is now reflected in FeCur
CONFSERVER-25329:
h3.Problem

Confluence gets lost when renaming application links.

{code}Error rendering macro 'jira' : Couldnt find an application link with the name {0}.{code}

h3.Steps to reproduce:
    Confluence 4.2.1 (Win 64-bit)
    JIRA 5.0.3 (Win 64-bit)

# Install JIRA
## Use Eval DB
## Port 8080
## Admin: jiraadmin
# Install Confluence
## Use Eval DB
## Port 9090
## Admin: confadmin
# In JIRA Administration, create App Link to Confluence
## URL: http://<hostname>:9090
## Name: JIRA (localhost)
## NOT a trusted link
## Create reciprocal link
## Configure link for Oauth, both ways
# Change default permission scheme to allow "Anyone" the "Browse projects" right
# Create JIRA project
# Create test issue in JIRA, copy the URL to the clipboard
# Go to Confluence dashboard
# Create new page
## Paste URL from JIRA into page (Confluence automatically converts it to the JIRA issue macro)
## Or "Insert Jira Issue" and then select a single JIRA Issue.
## Save page
## NOTE: No error message
# Go to Confluence Administration
## Go to application links
## Configure the link
## Rename the "Application Name" to something different
## E.g., "JIRA (localhost)" -> "JIRA (localhost) - Test Rename"
# Reload the Confluence page you previously created
## Note the error in place of the macro to the JIRA issue.

h3.Workaround

Delete and Recreate the Link with Another name.

JRASERVER-6288:
I am just testing out 3.1.1 and of course this was the first issue that I wanted to verify, and I must say, I'm extremely dissapointed by the solution...  A mask edit field with a date format as a mask???

The open source calendering component that JIRA uses, with one small change allows the date AND time to be entered.  Why was this now used?  It would be consistent with the data field, and very easy to use.
BSERV-12600:
Bitbucket Cloud warns users at 1GB and converts a repo to Read Only at 2GB.  How can administrators leverage similar functionality for on-premise versions of Bitbucket, like Server and Data Center?

This would be beneficial for performance locally, enable indexing to properly work and keep repositories in line with cloud guidelines, should the conversion from on-premise to cloud need to occur.
SERVER-36854: In order to persist the commit decision, we will need to modify the coordinator's state machine to have a new  state or states relating to "decided commit" and "persisting decision", as well as a new action "persist commit decision" and maybe "delete commit decision".

h2. Summary

Page title are empty when user click on an undefined page link.


h2. Steps to replicate

# Choose Advanced.
# Enter the name of the page to be created in the Link field and click insert
# Save the page
# Click on the the name you enter on the link field just now


h3. Observed behaviour

A new page will be open without a page title

When you click on the link, Confluence will create a draft page with the title you define in *Link Field*

Manually enter the page title
CLOUD-5975:
Large backup downloads (e.g. created by backup manager) through the WebDAV interface usually stops at 1GB.

h4. Workarounds

* Download using a download manager e.g. Firefox's [DownThemAll|https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/downthemall/].
* Use the Bash script shared in the comment [below|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-5975?focusedCommentId=397037&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-397037].
* Use the 'wget' command as suggested [below|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-5975?focusedCommentId=472783&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-472783].
JSDCLOUD-3126:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3126].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Create In-App notifications when the JIRA Service Desk Mail queue is congested or failing.
h3. Suggested Solution

In JIRA it is possible to raise alerts via In App Notifications, it would be good to have a notification raised for when the Mail queue is failing so that it can be easily brought to the Administrators attention. In particular in situations where customers rely on email as contact method the Administrators need to be aware as soon as possible that incoming mail is failing.
h3. Workaround

Manually review the Email Logs for failures.

BAM-20313:
h3. Summary

 When we try to delete remote agent from the Bamboo UI, we get {{500}} error and upon restart, the remote agent will reappear.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

There is NO possibility to create a duplicate capability
 * as the UI doesn't allow us to add duplicate capability. 
 * as there is no API for adding a capability to define a duplicate. 
 * as we cannot add via bamboo-capabilities.properties. If duplicates are found, they will be replaced with new key values.

However, if a duplicate entry is found, the respective remote agent cannot be deleted.
h3. Expected Results

The remote agent is deleted successfully. 
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{code:java}
Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Cannot delete or update a parent row: a foreign key constraint fails (`new`.`capability`, CONSTRAINT `FK_sm8xum6eu61qtx5twb34enyf9` FOREIGN KEY (`CAPABILITY_SET`) REFERENCES `capability_set` (`CAPABILITY_SET_ID`))
{code}
{code:java}
2017-09-26 21:19:39,041 ERROR [http-nio-8085-exec-17] [FiveOhOh] 500 Exception was thrown.
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: could not execute batch; SQL [delete from CAPABILITY_SET where CAPABILITY_SET_ID=?]; constraint [null]; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute batch{code}
{noformat}
2017-09-26 21:19:39,023 WARN [http-nio-8085-exec-17] [SqlExceptionHelper] SQL Error: 1451, SQLState: 23000
2017-09-26 21:19:39,023 ERROR [http-nio-8085-exec-17] [SqlExceptionHelper] Cannot delete or update a parent row: a foreign key constraint fails (`new`.`capability`, CONSTRAINT `FK_sm8xum6eu61qtx5twb34enyf9` FOREIGN KEY (`CAPABILITY_SET`) REFERENCES `capability_set` (`CAPABILITY_SET_ID`))
2017-09-26 21:19:39,023 ERROR [http-nio-8085-exec-17] [BatchingBatch] HHH000315: Exception executing batch [could not execute batch]
2017-09-26 21:19:39,023 ERROR [http-nio-8085-exec-17] [SessionImpl] HHH000346: Error during managed flush [could not execute batch]
2017-09-26 21:19:39,028 ERROR [http-nio-8085-exec-17] [ExceptionMappingInterceptor] could not execute batch; SQL [delete from CAPABILITY_SET where CAPABILITY_SET_ID=?]; constraint [null]; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute batch
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: could not execute batch; SQL [delete from CAPABILITY_SET where CAPABILITY_SET_ID=?]; constraint [null]; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute batch
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate5.SessionFactoryUtils.convertHibernateAccessException(SessionFactoryUtils.java:164)
 {noformat}
h3. Notes

It's throwing this error because we cannot delete data from parent table {{CAPABILITY_SET}} leaving the data behind in the child table \{{CAPABILITY }}which will result in orphan records.

And when Bamboo tries to delete data from CAPABILITY_SET, it leaves the data orphan in the table CAPABILITY.
h3. Workaround

We can find the duplicates with the help of below queries and then delete them manually:
{code:sql}
select KEY_IDENTIFIER ,value, count(*) from capability
where capability_set in (
select capability_set_id from  capability_set where capability_set_id=<ID>)
group by KEY_IDENTIFIER,value
having count(*) >1;

select * from queue
where agent_type='REMOTE'
and capability_set in (select capability_set from capability);{code}

h3. Suggested Solution:

 As we have validation in UI and even at the time of deletion of agent, we should have an unique constraint in the DB also to avoid duplicate entries.

Bet regards,
Max Horváth

*Original request description*
 
Currently, it is not possible to customize the subject line for notifications.
 
At present it is something like:
{noformat}[prefix] action: (project key) summary{noformat}
 
Perhaps a new feature could be to customize what order 'prefix', 'action','project' and 'summary' appear in. This could be done by providing the subject line as a velocity template that we can manually edit.
JRASERVER-33522:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33522].
  {panel}

Sometimes a issue changes more than once per minute, e.q. in a meeting to get the issue 'ready'. If this is case, the reporter and watcher receives a email every time a change is entered in the issue. This is generating a lot of email.
(In our case the reporter is the customer and we don't want to get annoyed by the huge load of emails).

I would like to have the possibility (in a notification scheme) to delay the emails, so that multiple changes are combined in one email, rather than several smaller emails every change. Or the possibility to select to get only one email a day.

This improvement I would very much like to see in the next version.

BAM-8247:
Important: this is not the functionality that can be achieved with the Custom Capabilities. We don't want to direct a Plan to be run in an agent, but to make some agents unavailable to some plans.

For instance, having Team A and Team B. We want Team A to run its Plans on Agent A only and Team B to run its Plans on Agent B only. Since there are limited resources, if Agent A is used by Team B, this will upset Team A, as it will have to wait B finishing using the resource.

SRCTREEWIN-1177:
If multiple commit links are present in a message, then the message does not get displayed correctly.

Here is an example commit message:

<---
Analyser - ScanChainController crash adding pin to list that need to be updated more than once.

Unsure how this happens but this looks to be the place where it occurs, so make more defensive.

Review 5356
Bug 8239
-->

We have two rules:
  [Bb]ug (\d+)  ->  http://bugs.ctg.local/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=$1
  [Rr]eview (\d+)  ->  http://review:8080/ui#review:id=$1

The commit text is displayed in SourceTree like this (I have enclosed the text that is made into a hyperlink with double square brackets):

<--
Analyser - ScanChainController crash adding pin to list that need to be updated more than once.

Unsure how this happens but this looks to be the place where it occurs, so make more defensive.

Review 5356
Analyser - ScanChainController crash adding pin to list that need to be updated more than once.

Unsure how this happens but this looks to be the place where it occurs, so make more defensive.

[[Review 5356]]
[[Bug 8239]]
-->
JRASERVER-47530:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-47530].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA by default displays all dates relative to when they occurred and can be configured to be displayed as an actual date, as per JRA-45928.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an alternative option here to show exactly the dates in hh:mm format.
 
For example: 
# Let's say the issue was created 29/Nov/15 11:10 AM.
# User is viewing the issue at 29/Nov/15 11:20 AM, the Created field needs to show 10m ago.
# And when the user view the same issue later in the day at 29/Nov/15 2:20 PM, the Created field should be 3h 10m ago.
CONFSERVER-28699:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-28699].
  {panel}

h1.Problem
Currently when a page uses \{excerpt-include\} the content that dynamically changes from the page we are including the page history remains the same.

h1.Fix
This to be fixed would required Confluence to sporadically parse the content, and then save into Confluence History the contents of that page, making it related to the time of the page and content.

JRASERVER-4451:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4451].
  {panel}

Standard response
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.
 
At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. While the idea is definitely solid, we're re-evaluating the entire JIRA notifications system, and that may entail new ways to customize emails that don't use velocity templates at all.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

It would be very handy if, instead of adding headers like 'Subject' programmatically, JIRA let headers be specified in the email velocity templates.

This would elegantly solve a number of problems, and open new possibilities:

 - Subject could be easily customized (JRA-3568) and i18nized (JRA-4419)
 - We could easily make the Precedence: Bulk header removeable, for users like the ASF where this triggers spam filters
 - The From: address could be customized easily (JRA-2315)
 - Custom headers could be added (JRA-3933, JRA-4440)

If this requires JIRA to parse the text to extract headers, we could read the To:, Cc: and Bcc: headers and append their values to the notification scheme targets.

SERVER-2956:
There were once a 'master-master replication' described here : http://www.mongodb.org/display/DOCS/Master+Master+Replication
which we used successfully with 1.4.2. However this configuration is not supported anymore, and it's not clear that is it working with newer versions, or can kill our kittens, if we try to use.
 Replica sets are not enough for this kind of work, when read, and write response times are extremely crucial to be fast, and we can accept that writes are propagated lazily in the background to the other server(s). So it would be nice, if clients could connect to 'slave' servers in the replica sets, and issue write request. For a write request the following needs to be performed :
 - apply the write request locally
 - respond to the client with success message - so the client see fast response times
 - the write request put into a 'localInitiatedOpLog' queue, which periodically flushed/sent to the actual master server.
 - the master server apply that changes and propagates to all the servers in the replica set. This algorithm will produce some strange effects, if the same object is modified concurrently by different slaves, or by the same slave in rapid succession, but at the end, every node will see the same objects, as the master node decides.

FE-2764:
Currently when showing a diff the r1 and r2 are ordered by date, so that the earliest revision will be to the left, and the latest to the right. 

Consider the following example where a customer is diffing a file from two different branches:

!http://img.skitch.com/20100901-ce3at32qyu29gfxqs11qmf5s98.jpg! 

Here they would rather have r1 = 1.48.4.4 and r2 = 1.53 considering that 1.48.4.4 is derived from an earlier revision.
CONFCLOUD-33291:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33291].
  {panel}

if you are trying to write a template for use with the AutoExport plugin, and you need access to the exported URL of an arbitrary AbstractPage (ie: the current page, or any of it's children) for any reason (in my current situation: to pass as a query param in an ifram for an external service) there is no way to do this (from the template):

* $page.urlPath (java: AbstractPage.getUrlPath()) is the pre-exported path in confluence
* $autoexport.link($page) (java: ExportUtils.link(AbstractPage)) generates an <a href=""/> for the page, still using the pre-exported path
* ExportBeautifier will look for html nodes with "href" and "src" attributes and convert the paths, but it won't look for paths in arbitrary text (ie: script bodies, escaped in iframe params, etc...)

It would be helpful if some object was made available in the VelocityContext that had a simple method for retrieving the final exported (relative) url of an arbitrary AbstractPage as a String, which could then be included in the response as is (or if necessary for passing as an argument in some other url, escaped using $generalUtil.urlEncode())

CONFSERVER-8445:
Using the Rich Text editor, you can re-size an image in a page. However when you save your changes, the image is not re-sized.

It is worth noting that if you edit the page using Wiki Markup instead of Rich Text, you can specify width and height attributes on the image:

You can specify an absolute size, for example:
{code}
   !image.jpg|width=640px, height=480px!
{code}

So the hooks are in place to get it working from the Rich Text editor.

Cheers,
Ian
JSWCLOUD-4996:
As a Rapid Board user I would like to be able to see sub-tasks of top level issue types if they are not included in the filter my rapid board is based on.

The main problem being addressed here is that it is not possible to have a filter which includes user stories, but not their tasks and still have the tasks shown on the rapid board.
A actual example of when this is required is the following. A company has X number of development teams that each have a rapid board. Each user story has a 'team' field which is tagged with the team currently working on the user story. The filter the rapid board is based could look something like 'team = "teamname"'. This filter would result in X amount of user stories being listed. With the current solution it isn't possible to list the subtasks of those user stories.

With the planning board this was not an issue as it would filter on fixVersion, which would include the subtasks. 

A workaround for this would be to simply tag the subtasks with the same team as the parent. While this is entirely possible, the hierarchy would break as soon as the team is changed on the parent.

Alternatively the JQL could be more advanced and support queries such as "issuetype = Task AND parent.team='teamname'"
JRASERVER-22351:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22351].
  {panel}

h2. Issue Description

Deleting a version from the project version which has issue still associated with them does not remove the entries from {{nodeassociation}} table. This causes the JQL query {{fixVersion is EMPTY}} not able to return those issues despite there is no Version associated.

h2. Steps to replicate

# Create a project version
# Associate to an issue's fixVersion
# Delete the project version and select remove version
# Verify the fixVersion is now shown as none
# Run JQL query for {{fixVersion is EMPTY}}
# Notice that the issue on step 2 does not list as result

h2. Expected Result
Returning the issue since the version is no longer valid

h2. Workaround
Delete the entries from the {{nodeassociation}} table manually for those issues that have no reference to the {{projectversion}} table:
{panel:borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
(!) *Important*: Always take a *full backup* from your database before doing any direct changes on database level - Please refer to the [Backing Up Data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Backing+Up+Data] for more details.
{panel}
# Verify how many affected entry using:
{code:sql|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
select (p.pkey || '-' || i.issuenum) as issuekey, n.sink_node_entity, n.sink_node_id 
from jiraissue i, project p, nodeassociation n 
where i.id = n.source_node_id
and i.project = p.id
and source_node_entity = 'Issue'
and sink_node_entity = 'Version' 
and sink_node_id not in (select id from projectversion);
{code}
(i) The above query does not work prior to JIRA 6.1
# Stop JIRA.
# Deleting the entries from the database:
{code:sql|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
delete from nodeassociation where source_node_entity = 'Issue' and sink_node_entity = 'Version' and sink_node_id not in (select id from projectversion);
{code}
# Start JIRA.
# [Re-index JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/search-indexing-185729671.html].

For JIRA Cloud customers, please raise an issue at [support|https://support.atlassian.com/customer/createIssue] and select JIRA Cloud project for assistance. 

Previous Description is located below:
{noformat}
I've worked around the problem described below by doing:

DELETE a.* FROM nodeassociation a
LEFT JOIN projectversion v ON a.SINK_NODE_ID = v.ID
WHERE a.ASSOCIATION_TYPE = 'IssueFixVersion'
AND v.ID IS NULL;

------ Forwarded Message
From: Justin de Vesine
Date: Thu, 23 Sep 2010 14:16:37 -0500
To: Matt McClure
Subject: Re: JIRA fixVersion appears as None, but doesn't match "fixVersion is EMPTY" query

This SQL query demonstrates the two healthy and one unhealthy case: MMF-3602, which has a fixversion; MMF-82, which doesn't have a fix version (and shows up in a JQL query like "fixVersion IS EMPTY and key = MMF-82"); MMF-92 (which has a fixversion which got deleted).

SELECT `jiraissue`.`pkey` AS `issue`, `nodeassociation`.`SOURCE_NODE_ID` AS `version_id`, `projectversion`.`vname` AS `version_name` FROM `jiraissue` LEFT JOIN `nodeassociation` ON `nodeassociation`.`SOURCE_NODE_ENTITY` = "Issue" AND `nodeassociation`.`SOURCE_NODE_ID` = `jiraissue`.`ID` AND `nodeassociation`.`SINK_NODE_ENTITY` = "Version" LEFT JOIN `projectversion` ON `projectversion`.`ID` = `nodeassociation`.`SINK_NODE_ID` WHERE `jiraissue`.`pkey` IN ('MMF-92', 'MMF-82', "MMF-3602") 

version_id and version_name both set or both null is good; only version_id set indicates the ticket has no valid fixversion but fixversion is not empty.

It appears that we have 990 such invalid fixversions set on various tickets:

SELECT `jiraissue`.`pkey` AS `issue`, `nodeassociation`.`SOURCE_NODE_ID` AS `version_id`, `projectversion`.`vname` AS `version_name` FROM `jiraissue` LEFT JOIN `nodeassociation` ON `nodeassociation`.`SOURCE_NODE_ENTITY` = "Issue" AND `nodeassociation`.`SOURCE_NODE_ID` = `jiraissue`.`ID` AND `nodeassociation`.`SINK_NODE_ENTITY` = "Version" LEFT JOIN `projectversion` ON `projectversion`.`ID` = `nodeassociation`.`SINK_NODE_ID` WHERE `nodeassociation`.`SINK_NODE_ID` IS NOT NULL AND `projectversion`.`vname` IS NULL

and cleaning them up (once you have satisfied your investigations) appears to be simple (DELETE FROM nodeassociation WHERE {stuff}).

It does not appear that the integrity tools built into JIRA or GreenHopper detect this issue.

-Justin

On Sep 23, 2010, at 10:41 AM, Matt McClure wrote:

This query finds the issue:

https://jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=key+%3D+MMF-92+AND+(fixVersion+not+in+releasedVersions()+OR+fixVersion+is+EMPTY+OR+fixVersion+in+unreleasedVersions())+AND+issuetype+in+(%22Theme:+Tier+1%22,+%22Theme:+Tier+2%22)+AND+NOT+status+in+(Closed,+Resolved)+ORDER+BY+Rank+ASC,+key+ASC

This query does not:

https://jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=key+%3D+MMF-92+AND+(fixVersion+is+EMPTY+OR+fixVersion+in+unreleasedVersions())+AND+issuetype+in+(%22Theme:+Tier+1%22,+%22Theme:+Tier+2%22)+AND+NOT+status+in+(Closed,+Resolved)+ORDER+BY+Rank+ASC,+key+ASC

Hypothesis 1: The issue has a fixVersion that no longer exists.

Hypothesis 2: There is a bug in JIRA or Greenhopper that corrupts fixVersion data on some issues.

Another observation: The query below matches 61 issues:

https://jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=fixVersion+not+in+releasedVersions()+and+fixVersion+not+in+unreleasedVersions()+and+fixVersion+is+not+EMPTY
{noformat}
JSDCLOUD-6173:
h3. Problem Definition
At times, customers would like to create a personal requests anonymously so that the request would not be tied to them. However, it is not possible at the moment as although customers log into the portal anonymously, they still need to key in an email address.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow customers to create their request as an anonymous user.

BAM-2070:
In bamboo we organize our build plans in project according to the actual projects in our organisation.
Each developer in the project team should be allowed to view and build all plans with the project.

In order to realize this, we need to set permissions on every plan within the project definition, which can be up to 25 builds for some projects.
Having the ability to set the permission on project and have them propagated to all build plans in the project would make bamboo even a greater tool!

SERVER-18025:
Currently, low disk space conditions only cause write operations to fail when the actual attempt to get/use more disk space from the OS fails.  It would help (operationally) if writes could additionally fail when the amount of free disk space falls below some configurable threshold (eg. 10GB).  This would leave some disk space as headroom that can be used to restore service, as opposed to the alternative of a filesystem that is either completely full or has a uselessly small amount of free space (eg. under 2GB).

A simple workaround for this (and the behaviour that I'm effectively asking for) is to allocate on disk a large dummy file of the desired size.  This will cause the filesystem to fill up "early", and if this happens the dummy file can be deleted to gain access to the "spare" disk space.
SERVER-24580:
When cache utilization hits 95% performance falls off a cliff, severely impacting production.

If the solution to this isn't to (gently) keep utilization from hitting 95%, then do we need to look at why threads getting involved in evictions at 95% is so impactful? Note that on in the incident on the primary that [~bruce.lucas] analyzed it appeared to me that the shortfall between evictions required to keep the cache steady and actual evictions was only 0.5%, yet the impact on operation rates and latencies to get application threads involved in evictions seemed far out of proportion to the shortfall that they had to make up.

If on the other hand evictions are really so fundamentally difficult that increasing eviction rate by 0.5% is hard, does it make sense to look at it from the other end, throttling application threads by the 0.5% required (in this example) to make up the shortfall by very slightly reducing rate of pages read into cache? A similar analysis of the lag incident on the secondary showed that the shortfall was about 9%, yet making up that shortfall when the cache hit 95% utilization nearly brings replication to a halt for extended periods.
CONFSERVER-52594:
h2. Use case
There are times when it is useful for administrators to get a number of active users that are taking up license seats in Confluence. This feature exists in *Confluence Admin > Licensing Details* for non-Unlimited license tiers, but is not calculated for the Unlimited tier.

Organizations may need this information if they are evaluating moving to a non-Unlimited license tier, or for general auditing purposes.

h2. Existing solutions and their limitations
In the UI, *Confluence Admin > System Information* will show a count of users. However this is simply a sum of all users stored in the {{cwd_user}} table of the database, and does not take in account of which users are marked as Active or check whether they belong in a Global Permissions group. The actual subset of active users counting towards the license can be much smaller.

There is also a [popular KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-get-a-list-of-active-users-counting-towards-the-confluence-license-298978076.html] which uses SQL queries to get a count of active users which do take up a seat. However, as stated on the KB, a major caveat is that nested groups will not be counted correctly due to the recursive manner in which user/group/membership objects are stored in the database. It is not uncommon for accounts using an unlimited license to also have nested groups (i.e. configured in LDAP).

h2. Older tickets on this topic
The following were closed years ago due to various reasons but none of them address the caveats outlined above. Given the age of these tickets I've opted to open a new request instead of reopening an old one, as some of the comments/attachments contained are now obsolete.
* CONFSERVER-11205
* CONFSERVER-26410
* CONFSERVER-17575
BSERV-12478:
Hello,

Running Makefiles and Python scripts correctly depends on the correct use of tabs and spaces.
We have a lot of Makefiles and Python scripts which are checking with pull requests every day.
With Bitbucket 7 we cannot show whitespace characters in the pull request anymore.
This option has been removed from the diff view action menu.
As a result our developers complain that it is very difficult for them to check the code of all the Makefiles and Python scripts.

Could you please fix this?

For this topic I found a suggestion https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-12245. 
Could you please change it to be a bug report? This seems to affect a lot of developers.

The attachment show the menu and the apperarance of  a makefile with Bitbucket 5.15 and with 7.3. As you can see with 5.15 you can see the error in the Makefile at a first glance and with Bitbucket 7 this is not possible anymore.


Best Regards, 
Milan

JRACLOUD-71792:
h3. Description
Although most email clients support SVG files, some of them still do not. In some cases, Outlook has problems with handling these files, causing them to be displayed as broken images.

Jira uses SVG images in profile avatars. When sending notifications about events triggered from within the application, sometimes these notifications will be displayed with broken images, which is a poor user experience.

h3. Expected behavior
Avatar images should always be displayed. In case they could not be displayed, an alternative should exist so that the client could process the email accordingly

h3. Actual behavior
Some clients cannot handle SVG images and therefore present a broken icon:
 !testOutlook2019.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
Add some kind of fallback to handle cases where client is unable to process this type of image
CONFSERVER-54158:
h3. Summary

h4. Scenario 1

When searching for a user in the page restrictions dialog, the user avatar image (or the default profile picture) is broken and the _alt_ text from the image is shown instead: 

 !restrictions.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Scenario 2

User avatar image is broken when mentioning a user in a page:

 !mention.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up Confluence with a context path 
# Create a user in Confluence
# Shutdown Confluence
# Change the base URL of the Confluence instance to another one, or remove the context path altogether
# Restart Confluence
# Create another user with a similar username as the one created in step 2
# Open the page restriction dialog on a page and search for the two users. 

h3. Expected Results

The users with thumbnails of their user avatars (or default profile pictures if no avatar was chosen) are shown correctly.

h3. Actual Results

The user created before the context path was changed will display a broken image in place of the thumbnail of their user avatar/profile picture. The user created after the context path change will display the thumbnail image correctly. 
 
h3. Notes

There were some similar problems but this is not the case.

* [Broken avatars/icons in Confluence after an upgrade due to corrupted cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/broken-avatars-icons-in-confluence-after-an-upgrade-due-to-corrupted-cache-329974322.html]
** Flushing the cache didn't solve the problem
\\
\\
* [After Adding a Context Path to the Base URL, Icons Appear as Broken Images|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/after-adding-a-context-path-to-the-base-url-icons-appear-as-broken-images-911933910.html]
** I confirmed that server.xml and confluence.cfg.xml had already been updated correctly

h3.Workaround

Rebuild the search index via the administration console. (See [User avatar breaks after changing the base URL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/user-avatar-breaks-after-changing-the-base-url-940695233.html] for the detail.)

h3.Workaround:
- go to the affected issue
- Select the drop-down top right of the attachmentmodule (See Screenshot)
- Select manage attachments
- Download all the images
- Delete the images
- re-upload the attachments to the issue
-- On the previous Bug Some users have found that after the .png re-loads in it still causes the error, if this occurs you can change the file type to .jpeg and this has worked for others effected by this bug.

{panel}
h3. This bug is fixed in JIRA 6.4.1 as per [JRA-35237|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35237]. 
{panel}
JSDSERVER-4379:
h3. Summary

It is not possible to edit a JIRA Service Desk comment when attachments are disabled in the JIRA Core settings.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Core 7.2.x
 * JIRA Service Desk 3.2.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Disable file attachments - [Configuring file attachments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/configuring-file-attachments-802593126.html].
 # Add a comment to a Service Desk enabled project.
 # Try to edit the comment.
 # Click on either 'Share with customer' or 'Add to issue only'.

h3. Expected Results

Editing the comment works and the comment is saved.
h3. Actual Results

A red banner is displayed with the error:
{quote}
*Failed to attach files*

You do not have permission to create attachments for this issue.
{quote}
!edit_comment.png|thumbnail!

The warning below is written to the standard Tomcat log (e.g. {{catalina.out}}) file:
{noformat}
11-Oct-2016 16:57:18.155 WARNING [http-nio-8721-exec-17] com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent.filterFormParameters A servlet request, to the URI http://jira.baseurl/rest/jddap/1.0/attachment, contains form parameters in the request body but the request body has been consumed by the servlet or a servlet filter accessing the request parameters. Only resource methods using @FormParam will work as expected. Resource methods consuming the request body by other means will not work as expected.
{noformat}

h3. Notes

Creating and deleting comments work as expected.
h3. Workaround

Enable file attachments before editing the comments.

BAM-12748:
Task: Add a new repository. A git repo on stash.a.c with a custom branch.

This has many problems...

I have a reference repo that I am copying. It claims it is a "Git" repo as the Source Repository field. BUG1: It should report "stash master on stash.a.c"

When not knowing this, selecting Git and filling in the appropriate fields then clicking save, apparently has no affect. BUG2: Validation errors not visible but are hidden in the advanced disclosure. BUG3: No visual clue is given that the operation failed. BUG4: Navigating to another location in the UI does not warn that config will be lost(I did this and had to start again).

On finally checking the Source Repository drop-down and figuring out that it was a shared repository...BUG5: Config of shared repos is only available to admin users(which luckily I am one).

BUG6: It *should* be possible to override fields of a shared repo. In particular the branch.

I'm suggesting the UX could be improved here somewhat.
JRACLOUD-72794:
h3. Issue Summary

The documentation [Advanced searching - fields reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-DescriptionDescription] says that to return issues where the description contains the exact phrase, users should use quotation marks, but when a user searches using quotation marks, for example, {{text ~ "\"Number of tests \""}}, other issues which contains some expressions are returned also
h3. Environment

Jira cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira project and add issues to it
 # Add the following text to the description of different issues (use each sentence to each issue)
 ** Number of tests made on this ticket
 ** Number made tests
 ** Number
 ** tests
 # Perform a search in Jira using the following JQL query

{code:java}
text ~ "\"Number of tests \""{code}
h3. Expected Results

Only the issue containing the text "{{Number of tests made on this ticket}}" is returned

!Screen Shot 2019-08-21 at 7.59.36 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The issues containing the text below are returned:
 * Number of tests made on this ticket
 * Number made tests

h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 21st Jan 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
After some analysis we've found that this issue has been duplicated by the issue at JRACLOUD-69263: JQL Contains "Exact Phrase" does not return the result as expected. This is a current and verified bug in Jira, please watch that issue for further updates and more detailed workarounds.
{panel}
JRACLOUD-70171:
h3. *Summary*

The new issue view won't display *Select List (cascading)* custom fields.

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Jira home -> *Issues* -> *Custom fields* -> *Add custom field*:
** Create a  *Select List (cascading)* custom field.
* ira home -> *Issues* -> *Screens* -> click on *Configure* next to a screen:
** Search for and click on the created field to add it to the screen.
* Go to an issue view (that is using the screen you have edited) when using the new issue view (profile icon -> *Personal settings* -> *Labs*).

h3. Expected Results

The field should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

The field won't be displayed.

h3. Workaround

The old view displays the field correctly.

JRASERVER-23266:
The emoticons are not rendered because the links to them are generated using relative urls. 

This is caused because because the JiraRendererConfiguration class tries to figure out whether to use relative urls or not by checking if there is a http request in the current thread, in this case this will be true because the email queue is flushed from the ui thread.

Implementation:

We shouldn't really be flushing the queue from the ui thread, rather we should do that in a different thread and that way we avoid this issue and the we longer block the ui thread which might be a problem if the queue is big.

JRASERVER-23487:
Hello,

In JIRA 4.1.2, you could have LDAP integrated with JIRA, and have users existing both in LDAP and JIRA, and only in JIRA database. While leaving the "External User Management" option ON, you could change the users' passwords in LDAP, and for the users which existed only in JIRA database, you could use ForgotLoginDetails.jspa page to reset their passwords.

However, this function is now not working on JIRA 4.2.2. If you copy the same environment as above, when trying to reach ForgotLoginDetails.jspa, you get a stacktrace on the screen.

Can this option be enabled again?

Cheers

Best Regards
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support

JRASERVER-34433:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34433].
  {panel}

JIRA has an amazing feature which allows users to get a snapshot of Issues to be sent via email periodically.

Unfortunately, the Subscription feature do not capture snapshots of issues( if issue count > 200). 

Ideally the Subscription feature should capture the snapshot of the filter(Issue-List) at the time the subscription email is sent. If the issue count is greater than 300, the link sent in the email should show the issue list and details at the time the subscription email was sent. If this is not achievable, it should atleast send the entire snapshot as an excel spreadsheet.

Feel free to term this as an enhancement/new feature.

JRASERVER-6972:
I noticed JavaScript errors on the issue page when using the german locale. The FireFox JavaScript Console shows the problem:

    initPinComments('Immer anzeigen',
                    'Immer 'Kommentar hinzufügen' Bereich anzeigen',
                    'Zunächst ausblenden',
                    ''Kommentar hinzufügen' Bereich zunächst ausblenden');


The same code from jira.atlassian.com looks like this:

    initPinComments('Always show',
                    'Always show add comment area',
                    'Initially hide',
                    'Initially hide comment area');

The problem is obviously some unencoded quotes. I could probably fix this by modifying the language properties, however it is a general problem: the contents of the language properties files must be properly encoded in any location.

2. Go to editor and open the "Insert JIRA Issue" dialogue.

JRASERVER-2041:
In the new permission scheme (and maybe the old one, but we never found this before), the 'reopen' permission is granted to users with the 'resolve' permission.  It seems to me that this permission should instead be linked with the 'close' permission.

As developers, we resolve issues for our users to test.  They have 'close' permission, but not 'resolve' permission.  So, if the issue they are testing turns out not to be fixed as required, they have no means of reopening the issue.  Whilst this is good news for us developers, the users are less happy :)
CONFCLOUD-59002:
h3. Summary
When a page is shared, the notification e-mail sent to the user will display its group instead of its username.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any page;
# Share it with anybody.

h3. Expected Results
The person will receive an e-mail reporting that a page was shared with its group.

h3. Actual Results
The person should receive an e-mail reporting that a page was shared with its username.
 
h3. Notes
This is a aesthetic issue, not impacting the system usage.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround.
JRASERVER-33357:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-33357].
  {panel}

_Steps to Reproduce_

* Create an issue {{TESTONE-1}} and include the comment "foo" inside the issue for the first comment:
!bug_1.JPG|thumbnail!

* Navigating to the *Advanced Search*, using the following parameter should not display the issue {{TESTONE-1}}:
{code}
comment !~ "foo"
{code}
!bug_2.JPG|thumbnail!

* However, navigating back to the issue page, try to add the second comment "bar" into the issue:
!bug_3.JPG|thumbnail!

* This issue is reproducible using the same parameter in the *Advanced Search* JQL whereby you can see that {{TESTONE-1}} is displayed, ignoring the original condition of the JQL:
!bug_4.JPG|thumbnail!

*Workaround*

* Create a filter such as {code}comment~foo{code}, which will return all the foo comments. Save it as {{foo comments}}
* Create a new filter as {code}filter!= "foo comments"{code}. This will exclude all issues from the previous filter and the desired results will be returned.

When Editing a sub-task the Descriptions are incorrect - being simply a copy of the Sub-Task Name rather than the actual Description as visible on the Manage Sub-Task page (as originally created).

*Steps to reproduce*
# Click {{add Sub-task Issue type}} button
# Enter sub-task's name and add description to the sub-task
# Click on Add
# Click on Edit

*Expected Behaviour*
Name and description will be displayed correctly

*Actual Behaviour*
Descriptions are incorrect - being simply a copy of the Sub-Task Name rather than the actual Description as visible on the Manage Sub-Task page 

*Workaround*
Edit the sub-task issue type description from Issue type Menu instead of Sub-task menu.

BSERV-3469:
When a user opens a pull request, some references are created inside the Git repository hosted in the Stash server. These references live in files stored in <STASH_HOME>\data\repositories\<REPO_ID>\refs\pull-requests\<PULL_REQUEST_ID>

This is great and allows one to, for example, configure the build server to build pull requests and the result of the merge.

However, *these references are never deleted from the Git repository*, so there's no way for a build server to know when to stop monitoring these references. Because of that, if you merged 1000 pull requests in the past, the build server will show you 1000 build results, one for each pull request, even though you already merged (or declined) these 1000 pull requests and are not interested in these build results anymore.

!pull-requests.png!

*I would expect the reference to be removed after the pull-request has been merged or declined. If a user reopens it, then the reference should be recreated*.

Thanks,
Caio Proiete

CLOUD-3924:
In standalone JIRA from version 4.2 onwards, when importing XML from an older version, if the index and attachment paths that are specified in the XML don't exist the importer will offer to reset them to the default paths ({{$JIRA_HOME/caches/}} and {{$JIRA_HOME/data/attachments/}}, respectively). When importing a customer's standalone data into Studio, however, it just stops (_after_ the potentially very lengthy parsing process) with an error:

{quote}
*Error*

The index path <old path> specified in the backup file is not valid.
The attachment path <old path> specified in the backup file is not valid.
path not found
{quote}

And there's no option to just continue on with the default paths. It really should just reset to the default paths and proceed with the import process.

SERVER-26990: ReplicationCoordinatorImpl::_slaveInfo and TopologyCoordinatorImpl::_hbdata contain a lot of duplicate information, and keeping that state separate prevents certain events from being triggered when information comes in via heartbeats or via replSetUpdatePosition.  We should push all this information down into the TopologyCoordinator and use it as the single source of information for making decisions about secondary state and replication progress.

if got a problem with the parser, if there is a "." in the arguments.

Namespace.SampleClass.SampleMethod(0.024m,1.2m,1.176m,58.8m)

JRASERVER-17580:
The search query syntax uses OR as the default conjunction operator: "??The OR operator is the default conjunction operator. This means that if there is no Boolean operator between two terms, the OR operator is used.??"

This appears to be copied verbatim from the Lucene documentation: http://lucene.apache.org/java/2_3_2/queryparsersyntax.html and I'm assuming it's the Lucene default behaviour that's showing through in Jira.

We don't consider this to be a particularly useful default and would much prefer AND to be the default conjunction.  It seems very easy to ask Lucene to perform searches this way, so I was wondering whether Jira could be configurable to call Lucene that way?
SERVER-43600:
From "How to Write a Technical Paper: Structure and Style of the Epitome of your Research":
{quote}
Solution

You should begin this section by providing an overview of
your solution. Give a good explanation of its rationale,
concepts and mechanisms. If your solution relies on a
theorem or some other undocumented concept, make sure
that you explain them before you carry on to the detailed
description.
The main part of this section is the thorough description of the solution and its functionality. The description
should not contain arguments on correctness or design decision debates; simply, describe the mechanisms of your
solution and avoid explanations of the “why so” type.
Dedicate a separate paragraph or two on the latter, if
you deem necessary.
Disassemble your solution to its functional components
and explain them separately. For example, if you describe
a distributed algorithm, explain the protocol-specific part
(message format, etc.) separately from the semantics and
decision-making part of the algorithm.
It is both important and useful to provide figures
demonstrating the functionality of your solution. Make
the figures look similar to the system model figure, if applicable, and exploit the similarities and differences to
point out important aspects of your solution.

Analysis

Analysis can be of two types: qualitative and quantitative.
The former means to show some properties (qualities)
of your solution, while the latter means to show some
performance aspects of your solution.
Qualitative analysis is usually proof of correctness,
however it could be proof that the solution possesses some
desired property. For algorithms or protocols, a proof of
correctness is always welcome.
Quantitative analysis is mostly performance analysis.
It is important to explain what performance metric you
use and why you have selected the specific metric. Choosing a metric that has been widely used will make the
comparison to other solutions easier.

Let's include any numbers we can measure: number of test runs, computing hours spent testing, number of states encountered and what percentage of the theoretical state space that is, lines of spec code, lines of implementation code in MongoDB.
{quote}

BAM-5619:
I just had a long conversation with a few people about an issue reported by a plugin developer, DEVNET-239.  The issue, fundamentally, was that the developer wanted to set up a Bamboo build for his project on PStudio.

Since I'm still basically the new guy here in Dev Relations, I just sort of assumed that would work, but I couldn't figure it out, so I asked [~twong].  He figured it should work too, and told me to re-file the developer's request as a support ticket, so I did: [JST-5567|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-5567].

But then I was talking with [~tmoore] and [~jkodumal] as well, and the answer was somewhere between "it's complicated" and "you can't do that."  We set up project developer groups in Studio as standard practice, so that multiple projects can share the same JIRA instance without allowing everybody write access to all projects' data, those permissions apply *only* to JIRA, not to Bamboo.  This was not at all obvious, and perhaps that's worthy of a JST issue...  Regardless, it seems like there's no way to give a particular user or group permission to create/modify plans specific to their project.  As far as I can tell, if a user can create/modify plans, they can do so for *all* projects, which is a pretty crippling security problem for Studio.

As a consequence, PStudio and StAC seem to have established a policy prohibiting developers from setting up Bamboo plans -- only administrators can do it.  One could imagine this being the case in other enterprise deployments of Studio as well.

Tim pointed me at a couple probably related, previously filed issues: BAM-2677 and BAM-2070.

Currently the format of the subject line is:
[JIRA] (JRA-12314) The summary of the issue

[JIRA] JRA-12314 The summary of the issue

For many of our staff, and our external clients, this minor changes makes it easier for them to scan large volumes of email.

JRACLOUD-13218:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-13218].
  {panel}

The issue navigator can not be order/filter by the new aggregate fields (time spent, original estimate, remaining estimate & progress) added in 3.11.
It would be nice to be able to order by these fields.

Due to permissions, you can not calculate these aggregates during issue indexing as you may not be able to see some of the sub-tasks and they will be different for users with different permissions.  Therefore, if we wanted to filter or order by these fields we would have to calculate it at run time for all issues in the database.
As these fields are calculated by running another Lucene search, a system with 30K issues in would run 30001 Lucene queries for every search done.

Another way to solve this problem is to build a report which would take in a saved filter and the aggregate fields to sort by and do the expensive operation.  Not the perfect solution, but it may satisfy the needs of some.

For the time being, you will need to export your results to Excel and then do a sort/filter in there.

If you are voting for this issue, please let us know if you would be happy with the report.
